sentences.en: As the era wore on, she switched her attention to films.
sentences.cn: 随着这个时代慢慢过去，她把目光投向了电影业。

sentences.en: Concord inaugurated a new era in airplane travel.
sentences.cn: 协和飞机开创了空中旅行的新纪元.

sentences.en: His death marked the end of an era.
sentences.cn: 他的去世标志着一个时代的终结。

sentences.en: In the mass production era multinational firms tended to centralize their operations.
sentences.cn: 在大规模生产的时代，跨国公司往往实行集权化经营。

sentences.en: In Wales in the same era, boys were caned for speaking Welsh in the playground.
sentences.cn: 在同一时期的威尔士，男孩们在操场上讲威尔士语是要吃鞭子的。

sentences.en: It emerged as the most intractable issue of our era.
sentences.cn: 它成了我们时代最难解决的问题.

sentences.en: It marks the beginning of a new era in human history.
sentences.cn: 这标志着人类历史新纪元的开始.

sentences.en: It was an era of austerity.
Ownership is not clear because of expropriations in the Nazi era.
sentences.cn: 纳粹时期的征用致使所有权不明确。

sentences.en: The Porsche 911 reminds me of the worst parts of the yuppie era.
sentences.cn: 这辆保时捷911让我想起了雅皮士时代最不堪的那些日子。

sentences.en: The room had the elegance of a bygone era.
sentences.cn: 这个房间有着旧时代的优雅.

sentences.en: These talks could herald a new era of peace.
sentences.cn: 这些谈判可能预示着新的和平时代的来临。

sentences.en: This is a film which seems to hail from the hippie era.
sentences.cn: 这看起来是一部嬉皮士时代的影片。

sentences.en: We are living in the information era.
We are on the threshold of a new era in astronomy.
sentences.cn: 我们很快就将迎来天文学的新纪元。

sentences.en: We live in an era of rationality.
sentences.cn: 我们生活在理性的时代。

trans.tran_en: a period of time in history that is known for a particular event, or for particular qualities
